revised_title: A Study on the Composition and Properties of Nitro-Glycerine
tldr: The author, A.W. Williamson, investigates the formation and properties of nitro-glycerine, a compound created by reacting glycerine with a mixture of concentrated nitric and sulfuric acids. He provides a qualitative analysis of the compound's composition and discusses its decomposition when boiled with a concentrated solution of potash.
